Hi, Elisabeth Garbeil. Welcome to the Backdrop CMS community on Zulip. I'm your friendly neighborhood Dragonbot. Try '@Dragonbot help' for a list of things I can help you with. There are lots of friendly humans that hang around here, so please feel free to ask questions.

Here is a short (3 min) video to help you navigate Zulip. https://youtu.be/DN8YL2MrsSU

@Elisabeth Garbeil I'd suggest starting to use Zulip now if you don't want to use both. I don't think Gitter will be decommissioned, but will stay as an unofficial support option for those who want it (just as Zulip has been unofficial (but still used) for the past few months). The community in Zulip will only grow while the community in Gitter will likely start to dwindle.

https://backdrop.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/218635-General/topic/%28no.20topic%29/near/190248128

Some comments above about how we chose Zulip and whether we could have done more involved stats and A/B testing.

My 2 cents is that I found Gitter broken in a few ways (sometimes randomly) - such as notifications not working at all and sometimes I couldn't see the latest message, etc. I have not found Zulip buggy like Gitter. Plus Zulip is getting much more active development than Gitter.

I agree with @Herb ...Zulip is not perfect, but I find it to be a much more pleasant experience than Gitter. The only things I miss from Gitter are a) the GitHub activity sidebar b) new forum post notifications ...point b should be relatively easy to fix I think

GitHub activity

I think we can get this also flowing into the # Core Notifications stream.
Yup, ...it was just convenient in the sidebar in Gitter.
I love that I can mute (a.k.a. hide/ignore) topics in Zulip. Helps reduce clutter for things I'm not interested in. But I still get notified if someone in that topic tags me, which is nice too.
